context: Before the Proving Grounds circuit race — an organized event in the warehouse district

lines.text: The warehouse district at midnight. The usual chaos of a street meet is replaced by something tighter — organized. Cars are lined up in formation. Somebody runs this operation.
Floodlights on tripods. A guy with a clipboard. Cones marking the circuit through the industrial lots. This isn't some parking lot sprint — this is the Proving Grounds.

lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: You the new one? Word got around after Harbor Road. Didn't think you'd actually show up here.
She's got a stopwatch around her neck and eyes that have seen a thousand races. Mid-thirties, short hair, zero tolerance for nonsense.

lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Here's how this works. Four laps around the circuit. Six drivers. No contact — you hit somebody, you're out. You wreck a cone on the chicane, ten-second penalty.

lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Buy-in is $500. Winner takes seventy percent of the pot. Second place gets their money back. Everyone else walks home lighter.

choices.text: I didn't come here to finish second.
Six drivers and no contact? That's a lot of trust.
How much is the pot looking like tonight?

lines.label: organizer_confident
lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Confidence. That's cute. Half the guys in this lineup have been running the Grounds for months. But sure — bring that energy to the start line and see what happens.
She marks something on her clipboard. You're in.

lines.label: organizer_nervous
lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Trust? No. Rules. Anybody makes contact, they answer to me. And the people I work with are a lot less forgiving than a ten-second penalty.

lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Relax. Drive clean, drive fast. That's all you gotta do.

lines.label: organizer_money
lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Six drivers at five hundred each — that's three grand in the pot. Winner walks with twenty-one hundred. Not bad for fifteen minutes of work, if you're fast enough.
Twenty-one hundred dollars. That's real money. Enough to upgrade the car. Enough to matter.

lines.label: proving_field
lines.text: You look at the competition. A tuned-up sedan with a hood scoop that means business. A low-slung coupe with mismatched panels — built, not bought. A clean hatchback running straight-pipe exhaust that rumbles through your chest.

lines.speaker: Organizer
lines.text: Drivers — line up. We go on the third horn blast. Keep it clean, keep it fast, and don't embarrass yourselves.
You strap in. The floodlights cut hard shadows across the asphalt. Your hands find the wheel. This is a step up from Harbor Road, and everyone here knows it. Including you.
The first horn blast cuts through the night. Engines rev in response — a wall of sound that rattles the warehouse windows. This is the Proving Grounds. Time to prove something.
